New Records: England only managed one shot on target in the entire contest
Key Match Events: Jón Dagur Þorsteinsson scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute
Harry Kane missed a golden chance in the 28th minute
Iceland finished the stronger side and were good value for the win
Pre-Game Insights: England's Euro 2024 preparations took a hit on the eve of the tournament
The defeat drew comparisons to England's stunning defeat to Iceland at the 2016 European Championships
Gareth Southgate described the result as 'good' for the team
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate said the result was 'disjointed and disappointing' but 'good' for the team
Former England players Wayne Rooney and Joe Cole were more positive, emphasizing the importance of experience and preparation
Miscellaneous Highlights: John Stones was replaced at half-time after appearing to roll his ankle
The match was the final game before the Euros in Germany, where England faces Serbia in their opening Group C match
